meanings.definition: Highest in position, rank, or importance.
meanings.sent1: The upmost shelf in the cupboard is hard to reach.
meanings.sent2: She placed the trophy on the upmost shelf to display it prominently.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was the upmost important task to knock over the vase.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work reached the upmost heights of success.
meanings.sent5: The upmost peak of the mountain offered a breathtaking view of the valley below.

meanings.sent1: Her upmost effort in the race earned her a gold medal.
meanings.sent2: He showed his upmost respect for his elders by listening attentively.
meanings.sent3: The upmost surprise of the party was when the cake fell on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship reached the upmost level of trust and understanding.
meanings.sent5: The upmost joy filled her heart when she saw her long-lost friend.
